meanings.sent1: She gets huffy when someone disagrees with her.
meanings.sent2: He was huffy after being criticized for his work.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked huffy when it was ignored for too long.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds seemed huffy before the storm hit.
meanings.sent5: The child's huffy expression showed his hurt feelings clearly.

meanings.sent1: The customer gave a huffy response to the slow service.
meanings.sent2: She crossed her arms in a huffy manner.
meanings.sent3: The huffy driver honked loudly at the slow traffic.
meanings.sent4: The huffy teacher scolded the students for being late.
meanings.sent5: His huffy tone made it clear he was not pleased with the situation.

meanings.definition: In a bad mood or temper
meanings.sent1: She woke up feeling huffy and didn't want to talk to anyone.
meanings.sent2: He stomped around the house in a huffy manner.
meanings.sent3: The huffy toddler refused to eat his vegetables.
meanings.sent4: The huffy boss yelled at everyone in the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The huffy atmosphere in the room made everyone uncomfortable.
